Article.ArticleTitle: MAX-DOAS and in-situ measurements of aerosols and trace gases over Dongying, China: Insight into ozone formation sensitivity based on secondary HCHO.

AbstractText: This study presents a comprehensive overview of the atmospheric pollutants including Sulfur dioxide (SO<sub>2</sub>), Nitrogen dioxide (NO<sub>2</sub>), Formaldehyde (HCHO), Particulate Matter PM; PM<sub>10</sub>: diameter ≤ 10 µm, and PM<sub>2.5</sub>: diameter ≤ 2.5 µm), and Ozone (O<sub>3</sub>)<sub>,</sub> over Dongying (Shandong Province) from March-April 2018 and September-October 2019 by employing ground-based Multiple Axis Differential Optical Absorption Spectroscopy (MAX-DOAS) observations along with the in-situ measurements attained by the national air quality monitoring platform. The concentrations of SO<sub>2</sub> and NO<sub>2</sub> were under the acceptable level, while both PM<sub>2.5</sub>, and PM<sub>10</sub> were higher than the safe levels as prescribed by national and international air quality standards. The results depict that 21% of the total observation days were found to be complex polluted days (PM<sub>2.5</sub> > 35 µg/m<sup>3</sup> and O<sub>3</sub> > 160 µg/m<sup>3</sup>). The secondary HCHO was used for accurate analysis of O<sub>3</sub> sensitivity. A difference of 11.40% and 10% during March-April 2018 and September-October 2019 respectively in O<sub>3</sub> sensitivity was found between HCHO<sub>total</sub>/NO<sub>2</sub> and HCHO<sub>sec</sub>/NO<sub>2</sub>. The results indicate that primary HCHO have significant contribution in HCHO. O<sub>3</sub> formation predominantly remained to be in VOC-limited and transitional regime during March-April 2018 and September-October 2019 in Dongying. These results imply that concurrent control of both NOx and VOCs would benefit in ozone reductions. Additionally, the criteria pollutants (PM, SO<sub>2</sub>, and NO<sub>2</sub>) depicted strong correlations with each other except for O<sub>3</sub> for which weak correlation coefficient was obtained with all the species. This study will prove to be baseline for designing of air pollution control strategies.
